author: arnetheduck
content: There's another aspect to metrics which is that while some metrics can be universally implemented, others are tied to the specific implementation as well, and the optimizations and flow of data particular to the client - we've successfully had contributors port prysm dashboards to nimbus, and while it takes a little bit of effort, it's certainly reasonably doable - on one of the recent calls, there was a call to standardise some of the metrics at least, and a starting point might be https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-metrics - if someone wants to contribute, assessing what metrics clients share already and documenting similarities and difference would be a good starting point

author: arnetheduck
content: regarding slashing, slashings to date have been centered around people running multiple instances of the same validator - we have doppelganger protection as an (imperfect) guard against that in some clients - by the time you get to the metrics and long-term monitoring stage, you have already passed this most significant risk ðŸ˜‰
